title: How Trump Won in 2016
author: Tom W. Hartung
card_content_html:
These images show that Donald [ESFJ] and Steve [ENTJ] are both outgoiong and decisive, but otherwise opposites.

This story — which is excerpted from the book Visualizing Politicians' Personalities — describes how a shared goal motivated them to combine their differing abilities and work as a team to get Donald elected President of the United States in 2016.
card_first_person_html:
The story appears as a chapter entitled Team Nat-Pop in the ebook entitled Visualizing Politicians' Personalities, 2019 Incumbents and Candidates that I wrote in 2019.

While researching the book — which focuses on the personalities of the top four incumbents and nine leading primary candidates — I became very curious about Steve Bannon.

After reading biographies, memoirs, and the like for the central subjects, I checked out Michael Wolff's book Fire and Fury, which kept coming up in my searches at the library. Michael's book led to reading Devil's Bargain by Joshua Green and ultimately Bannon: Always the Rebel by Keith Koffler.

This story is written from a Jungian perspective and summarizes what I learned from these books — and these images. If you like this story, you can find the entire ebook Visualizing Politicians' Personalities, 2019 Incumbents and Candidates online today at amazon.com!
